intro: Calyptrosicyos, commonly known as the African burr cucumber, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, gourds, and squash. The plant produces yellow flowers and develops spiny, spherical fruits that contain edible seeds. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and trailing. Calyptrosicyos is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
